sen.e: Yoshisada ISSHIKI (year of birth unkown - September 24, 1582?) was the family head of the Isshiki clan.

sen.j: 一色義道の子、別名義有、義俊、満信。
sen.e: Son of Yoshimichi ISSHIKI, and his other names were Yoshiari, Yoshitoshi and Mitsunobu.

sen.j: 妻は細川幽斎の娘の伊也（『一色軍記』では”菊の方”）。
sen.e: His wife was Iya, daughter of Yusai HOSOKAWA (in the "Isshiki Gunki" (the war chronicle of the Isshiki clan), she is referred to as "Kiku no kata").

sen.j: 剛勇に優れた猛将で、父の義道と共に織田信長配下の細川軍の侵攻を退けていたという。
sen.e: Yoshisada was a strong general who had valiance, and was, along with his father Yoshimichi, defending against the invasion by the Hosokawa's army which was under the control of Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 1579年、父が味方の裏切りによって殺されると、家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1579 when his father was killed by betrayal of a partisan, Yoshisada took over as head of the family.

sen.j: 一色氏の残党を率い、弓木城で徹底抗戦する。
sen.e: He led the remnants of the Isshiki clan for a do-or-die resistance at the Yuminoki-jo Castle.

sen.j: このため明智光秀は、細川幽斎の娘を義定に娶わせることで和議を結んだ。
sen.e: Thus, Mitsuhide AKECHI compromised with him by letting Yoshisada marry the daughter of Yusai HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: その後は信長に仕える。

sen.j: 1581年の京都御馬揃えにも出席、武田氏の討伐にも細川氏と共に従軍している。
sen.e: He attended the great military parade in Kyoto in 1581, and joined the suppression of the Takeda clan along with the Hosokawa clan.

sen.j: しかし1582年の、山崎の戦いでは明智光秀に味方した。
sen.e: At the Battle of Yamasaki in 1582, however, Yoshisada sided with Mitsuhide AKECHI.

sen.j: 藤孝の婿であったため豊臣秀吉には当初は黙認された。
sen.e: Since Yoshisada was married to the daughter of Fujitaka, at first Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI gave silent approval.

sen.e: Since Yoshisada was married to the daughter of Fujitaka, at first Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI gave silent approval to him.

sen.j: しかし、やがて、秀吉から細川忠興に、義定が謀反を企んでいることの報せが届くと、義定を疑った藤孝と忠興により宮津城に招かれてだまし討ちにより殺害された。
sen.e: However, when Hideyoshi reported to Tadaoki HOSOKAWA that Yoshisada was planning a rebellion, Fujitaka and Tadaoki, who were suspicious about Yoshitada, invited him to the Miyazu-jo Castle and killed him by a deceptive attack.

sen.j: 義定の殺害と同時に、城内に入っていた家臣も皆殺しにされた。
sen.e: When Yoshisada was killed, all the vassals who went into the castle were also killed.

sen.j: 城下に控えていた雑兵100人も、松井康之、米田求政率いる軍勢に討ち取られ、その勢いで弓木城も降伏させられた。
sen.e: A hundred zohyo who were waiting at the castle town were also defeated by an army led by Yasuyuki MATSUI and Motomasa YONEDA, which resulted in the fall of the Yuminoki-jo Castle.

sen.j: なお、妻の伊也は降伏した際に、細川家に戻った。

sen.j: この一色氏の滅亡により、この後は丹後全域を細川家が支配することとなった。
sen.e: Due to this fall of the Isshiki clan, the whole area of the Tango Province came to be under the controll of the Hosokawa clan since then.

sen.j: 没した日について、『一色軍記』においては本能寺の変以前の2月に義俊（義定）が殺害されたことになっている。
sen.e: According to the "Isshiki Gunki" (the war chronicle of the Isshiki clan), Yoshitoshi (Yoshisada) was killed in February, which was before the Honnoji Incident.

sen.j: しかし、『丹州三家物語』においては9月に殺害されたとしており、上宮津盛林寺に存在する「一色満信」の位牌においても9月8日と記されている。
sen.e: However, according to the "Tanshu sanke monogatari" (the tale of the three families in Tanshu), Yoshisada is said to have been killed in September; the Buddhist mortuary tablet of 'Mitsunobu ISSHIKI' which exists at the Seirin-ji Temple in Kami-Miyazu also says the date of Yoshisada's death was September 8.

sen.e: Some people say that Shigeyuki ISSHIKI, who was a guest freeloader of Michikiyo ISHIKAWA at Niihama City, Iyo Province, was the third son of Yoshisada who survived the attack by the Hosokawa clan.
